description: Core discovery questions for all projects (from-scratch workflow)

questions.question: What problem does this solve?
questions.subtext: (Be specific: What's broken? Why does it matter?)
examples: Personal trainers spend 10+ hours/week on spreadsheets that are error-prone and don't provide visual insights
Users can't visualize their fitness progress over time, leading to lack of motivation
Small businesses struggle to manage inventory across multiple locations with real-time accuracy
questions.bad_example: I want to build a fitness app
questions.good_example: Personal trainers struggle to track client progress across workouts. They use spreadsheets which are error-prone and don't provide visual insights. This leads to ineffective program adjustments and client churn.
follow_ups: Why is this problem worth solving?
What happens if this problem isn't solved?
What existing solutions have you tried? What didn't work?

questions.question: Who will use this?
examples: Gym-goers aged 25-40 training for strength, currently using pen and paper
Personal trainers managing 10-50 clients, frustrated with spreadsheet chaos
Small retail business owners with 2-5 locations, need real-time inventory visibility
questions.bad_example: People who want to get fit
questions.good_example: Two user segments: (1) Gym-goers aged 25-40 training for strength, currently using pen and paper or basic apps. (2) Personal trainers managing 10-50 clients, frustrated with spreadsheet chaos and lack of client insights.
follow_ups: What are their biggest frustrations with current solutions?
What are their goals when using this product?
How tech-savvy are they?

questions.question: How will you know this is successful? What metrics matter?
examples: 50 active trainers using the platform within 3 months
80% client retention rate (vs 60% industry average)
Trainers save 5+ hours/week on admin work
10,000 workouts logged per month by month 6
questions.good_example: Success metrics: (1) 50 active trainers within 3 months, (2) 80% client retention rate (vs 60% industry average), (3) Trainers save 5+ hours/week on admin work, (4) $10k MRR by month 6
follow_ups: What's the target value for each metric?
When do you expect to hit these targets?
Which metric is most important?

questions.question: Why now? What makes this the right time to build this?
examples: Fitness industry growing 23% annually, but trainer tools haven't evolved
Remote training exploded during COVID, but tools are fragmented
Competitors focus on consumers, not trainers (B2B opportunity)
follow_ups: Who else is solving this problem?
What makes your approach different?
What's the market size?

questions.question: What are the core features you envision?
questions.subtext: (List 3-10 features, we'll extract explicit and implied)
examples: Workout logging with exercises, sets, reps, weight
Progress tracking with charts over time
Trainer dashboard to manage multiple clients
Client mobile app for logging workouts
follow_ups: For each feature, what's the user value?
Which features are essential for launch (MVP)?
Which features can wait for v2?

questions.question: What frameworks/languages does your team have experience with?
examples: React + Node.js + PostgreSQL
Rails + PostgreSQL
No preference, open to recommendations
Python (Django or FastAPI) preferred
follow_ups: Are you open to learning new tech, or stick with what you know?
Do you have frontend/backend expertise?
Any strong preferences or dealbreakers?

questions.question: When do you want to launch the MVP?
examples: 3 months (need to launch quickly, minimal features)
6 months (balanced approach, solid feature set)
1 year (comprehensive platform, multiple user types)
follow_ups: What's driving this timeline?
What's the minimum feature set to launch?
Can you launch with fewer features to get feedback?

questions.question: What's your monthly budget for hosting/services?
examples: < $50/mo (free tiers, tight budget)
$50-500/mo (startup budget, paid tiers)
$500+/mo (growth stage, managed services)
follow_ups: Is this for MVP or long-term?
Do you have budget for third-party services (auth, payments, etc.)?
